author: James Joyce
text: Dear Miss Weaver: I shall begin my fifth hegira on Sunday and hope to arrive in London Whittington-like that evg. (w.p.). Will you please retain rooms for us at Garlandâ€™s (Lucia comes too). If detained at Calais I shall countermand by wire. I am a good deal better and only wish I could stay at this inn for another week. With kindest regards sincerely yours James Joyce P.S. I suppose I may have mail sent to your address for a day or so?
